item.title: Arch Linux - News: Valkey to replace Redis in the [extra] Repository
item.description: Valkey, a high-performance key/value datastore, will be replacing redis in the [extra] repository. This change is due to Redis modifying its license from BSD-3-Clause to RSALv2 and SSPLv1 on March 20th, 2024.

item.title: Suffering as a seed for change - how to turn limitations into strength
item.description: Discover how personal suffering can become a catalyst for positive change. The story of a leader with haemophilia shows how consciously overcoming difficulties builds empathetic leadership and discipline based on growth and innovation.

item.title: Your Software Is Confusing
item.description: If something in your software is confusing to a customer, it is confusing.

item.title: The Zen of Task Management with Org
item.description: I don't use Org Mode to be more productive, but to achieve a kind of "ataraxia" (i.e. a "lucid state of robust equanimity" according to Wikipedia) about the things I have to do: pay my bills on time and enjoy concentrating on my work. After more than 15 years of refining my Org configuration, I can't say it's perfect, but it's stable and comfortable enough that I think it might be useful to others.

item.title: Use Redis With HybridCache to Cache Your EF Core Data!
item.description:
In earlier videos in the series, we saw how we could convert our Entity Framework Core data access from IMemoryCache to HybridCache!
But... there was one big problem:
It was still just a memory cache behind the scenes!
Let's see how we can get Redis wired up to our HybridCache!
---- Real-World Web Development With .NET 9: https://amzn.to/4lCy3wk ---- Timestamps:

item.title: TLS Certificate Lifetimes Will Officially Reduce to 47 Days
item.description: The CA/Browser Forum has officially voted to amend the TLS Baseline Requirements to set a schedule for shortening both the lifetime of TLS certificates.

item.title: Astronomers have found the 'most promising signs yet' of alien life on a planet beyond our Solar System
item.description: Astronomers find most promising signs yet of biosignature on exoplanet K2-18b, dimethyl sulfide, which could indicate life on its surface.

item.title: I Confronted MassTransit's Creator
item.description:
Get 40% off everything on Dometrain: https://dometrain.com/courses/?ref=nick-chapsas&promo=youtube&coupon_code=BIRTHDAY2 Subscribe to my weekly newsletter: https://nickchapsas.com
Become a Patreon and get special perks: https://www.patreon.com/nickchapsas
Hello, everybody. I'm Nick, and in this video, I will chat with MassTransit creator Chris Patterson about open source and his decision to change MassTransit from a free open source project to a commercial one.
Workshops: https://bit.ly/nickworkshops
Don't forget to comment, like and subscribe :)

item.title: Build a MCP Server with C#
item.description:
This video provides a step-by-step guide to creating a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server using C#. MCP is a standardized protocol designed to facilitate communication between AI models and applications.
- Model Context Protocol: https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol - Get GitHub Copilot: http://aka.ms/copilot-free - C# SDK: https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/csharp-sdk
Chapters: 00:00 - Introduction 00:57 - What is Model Context Protocol (MCP)? 11:37 - Enabling MCP in VS Code 14:06 - Configuring MCP Servers in VS Code 21:05 - Implementing a MCP Server with C# 35:15 - Publish a MCP Server
Become a channel member to enjoy benefits and access more content. https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKnuLHRlK_zhrpaTWvNOdMA/join
item.author: (Javier Su√°rez)
